question: Question_09_(b)
statement:
\textbf{Full-Solution Problems}. In questions 4â12, justify your
answers and \textbf{show all your work}. If a box is provided, write
your final answer there. \textbf{Unless otherwise indicated,
simplification of numerical answers is required in these questions}.

Determine, with explanation, whether the following series converges or
diverges.

\begin{align*}\displaystyle 
\sum_{n=1}^\infty \frac{2n+1}{2^{2n+1}}\end{align*}
sols:
We use the ratio test:

\begin{align*}
\lim_{n\to\infty} \left|\frac{2(n+1)+1}{2^{2(n+1)+1}} \cdot \frac{2^{2n+1}}{2n+1}\right| &= \lim_{n\to\infty} \frac{2n+3}{2n+1} \cdot \frac{2^{2n+1}}{2^{2n+3}} \\
&= \lim_{n\to\infty} \frac{2+\tfrac{3}{n}}{2+\tfrac{1}{n}} \cdot \frac{1}{2^2} \\
&= \frac{1}{4} \\
& < 1\end{align*}

So by the ratio test, the series converges.
